text: Richard I. Cocke (August 13, 1820 – August 30, 1873) was a nineteenth-century American politician from Virginia. ==Early life== Cocke was born in Powhatan County, Virginia in 1820. He graduated from the University of Virginia in 1836-37, and earned a Bachelor of Laws from the College of William and Mary in 1839.Pulliam 1901, p. 104 ==Career== The Virginia Capitol at Richmond VA where 19th century Conventions met As an adult, Cocke made his home in Fluvanna County beginning in 1844, and served there for many years as Commonwealth’s Attorney.Pulliam 1901, p. 104 At the age of twenty-nine, Cocke was elected to the Virginia House of Delegates 1849-50.Pulliam 1901, p. 104 In 1850, Cocke was elected to the Virginia Constitutional Convention of 1850. He was one of three delegates elected from the central Piedmont delegate district made up of his home district of Fluvanna County, as well as Goochland and Louisa Counties.Pulliam 1901, p. 99 During the American Civil War, Cocke served as a Captain of artillery, C.S.A.Pulliam 1901, p. 104 Cocke was elected as a Virginia State Senator after the war, then afterwards he removed to Blandsville in Ballard County, Kentucky.Pulliam 1901, p. 104 ==Death== Richard I. Cocke died in Blandsville, Kentucky on August 30, 1873.Pulliam 1901, p. 104 == References == ==Bibliography== * Category:Members of the Virginia House of Delegates Category:1820 births Category:1873 deaths Category:Virginia state senators Category:People from Powhatan County, Virginia Category:People from Fluvanna County, Virginia Category:People of Virginia in the American Civil War Category:University of Virginia alumni Category:College of William & Mary alumni Category:County and city Commonwealth's Attorneys in Virginia Category:People from Ballard County, Kentucky Category:19th-century American politicians
title: Richard I. Cocke
